title: Formative Practice for the FRQ 3 - Non-syllabus Part A

content.description:
Please note: Students will benefit from closely reading this passage before proceeding to respond to the question parts.

The Historian Eutropius’s Praise of the Emperor Trajan

Civilitatecivilitas, -atis, f.: friendliness et moderationemoderatio, -onis, f.: restraint superavit:1 Romae et per provincias
aequalemaequalis, -e, adj.: equal se omnibus exhibensexhibeo, -ere: to present, amicos salutandi causacausa = “for the sake of” + genitive 
frequentansfrequento, -are: to visit vel aegrotantesaegroto, -are: to be sick vel cum festosfestus, -a, -um, adj: (of a) festival dies habuissent,
nullum senatorum laedens, nihil iniustuminiustus, -a, -um, adj.: unjust ad augendumaugeo, -ere: to increase fiscumfiscus, -i, m.: the imperial treasury

agens, liberalisliberalis, -e, adj.: generous2 inin, prep. (+ acc.): toward cunctos, publicepublice, adv.: publicly privatimprivatim, adv.: privatelyque ditansdito, -are: to enrich omnes
et honoribus augensaugeo, -ere: to praise, quos velvel, part.: even mediocrimediocris, -e, adj.: a small amount of familiaritatefamiliaritas, -atis, f.: familiarity cognovisset,
per orbem terrarum aedificans multa, nihil non tranquillumtranquillus, -a, -um, adj.: calm et
placidumplacidus, -a, -um, adj.: friendly agens.

Brev. 8.4
 1:The subject of superavit is the Roman Emperor Trajan.↩
2:Supply “being.”↩
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.

Identify one and only one of Trajan’s actions that exemplifies his friendliness, as described in lines 1-3 (Romae...habuissent).

Provide the Latin word(s) that support your answer in Part (i). 

Translate in context the Latin word(s) you cited in Part (ii).

frqParts.text:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.

Identify one and only one of Trajan’s actions that exemplifies his friendliness, as described in lines 1-3 (Romae...habuissent).

Provide the Latin word(s) that support your answer in Part (i). 

Translate in context the Latin word(s) you cited in Part (ii).
